title: Enough guts to say no
creator_credit: Virginia Westbury, Paul Griffiths, National Heart Foundation of Australia and Paul Griffiths Presentations
brief_description: Designed to show teenagers that their desire to smoke is a subtle manipulation of their desire to belong and be accepted. Non-smoking teenagers demonstrate that liking and being liked is not related to smoking and that potential friends may be turned off by it.
creator_credit_for_label: Virginia Westbury, Paul Griffiths, National Heart Foundation of Australia and Paul Griffiths Presentations
